content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's how you can do it in Python using regex:

```python
import re

def extract_julia_code(md):
    pattern = r'```julia\n(.*?)\n```\n?'
    matches = re.findall(pattern, md, re.DOTALL) # DOTALL flag makes .* match any character including newline
    
    if len(matches) > 0:
        return "\n".join(matches).strip() + "\n"
    else:
        return ""
```

This function `extract_julia_code` will search for code blocks in the markdown document, remove the ```julia and \n lines at both ends of each block, concatenate them together with newline characters between each block (if there are multiple), and then strip any leading/trailing whitespaces.

Please note that the function `extract_julia_code` returns an empty string if no julia code blocks are found in the markdown document. If you want to return a specific message instead of nothing, you can modify the last line to: `return "No Julia code block found"`.
